results.title: Coal crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Part of a series of films on the importance of coal in the national economy of Great Britain, examining the problems facing the National Coal Board in 1947. This film makes an urgent plea for recognition of the coal industry to Britain and the steps that must be takn to stabilise the industry and increase its output.

results.title: Ceylon: the new dominion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
A survey of the history and position (as at 1948) of Ceylon (Sri Lanka), the newest Dominion of the British Commonwealth. Shows the civilization of the Lion People who invaded Ceylon from Northern India; the influence of Portugese and Dutch colonization which preceded British rule. The achievements of a 150 years of British rule are evaluated. The practical results of British government in terms of increased production of tea, rubber and coconuts are illustrated. Shows the modern educational system; defeat of malaria; extension of irrigation and recolonization of the north; difficulties facing the new Dominion. The population of six and a half million people is made up of five races with four religions and three languages. Poverty, lack of finance, high cost of imported food are barriers to progress, but progressive social schemes have been started.

results.title: The British: are they artistic?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Overview of the Arts in post-World War II Britain and what the British government did to encourage the Arts. No other credits available.

results.title: Antarctic whalehunt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Part of the series “This Modern Age”, this film deals with modern methods of hunting and killing whales, the case for more humane methods, and the possible effects of indiscriminate depletion of the number of whales in the Antarctic.

results.title: The First essential skills
results.creator_credit: Joachim Schult, Richard Creagh-Osborne and United Nautical Publishers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Sailing”.
One of a course of three films of instruction in sailing a small light dinghy (420 class). Intended for schools, sailing schools and clubs. Animation by Peter Milne.

results.title: Britain's new resources
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A brief study of the uses to which Britain is putting her limited natural resources; the harvesting, scientific drying, and storing of short grass for feeding cattle all the year round; the planting of forests and cutting of timber; harnessing of hydro-electric power; soap manufacture without fats; the use of seaweed in the manufacture of many products; production of magnesium from the waters of the North Sea.

results.title: An Hour from London
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”
Depicts the great variety of scenery and historical landmarks near to London. By road one can go to East Anglia; by rail to Brighton; by boat to Henley, Oxford, Windsor Castle and Hampton Court. Down the Thames at Greenwich are mementos of Lord Nelson and Samuel Pepys.

results.title: Old crafts new graces
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Shows that, although the machine dominates the industrial scene of today, traditional British craftsmanship still plays an essential part in the production of certain goods. Examples illustrating such craftsmanship include: the making of a fishing rod; the work of the silversmith; skill with leather in the manufacture of saddles.
